summary: This document is an email correspondence discussing cash transfer requests related to various accounts associated with Epstein. It includes details about the amounts and statuses of these transfers, as well as requests for confirmation on outstanding debits. The email highlights the financial activities and management of Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Harry Beller
persons.context: Harry Beller is the sender of the email discussing cash transfer requests.

persons.name: Amanda Kirby
persons.context: Amanda Kirby is the recipient of the email from Harry Beller regarding cash transfers.

persons.name: Janet E. Young
persons.context: Janet E. Young is mentioned as the Vice President at J.P. Morgan, providing a summary of cash transfer requests.

persons.name: Gina Magliocco
persons.context: Gina Magliocco is listed as an alternate contact in the email.

persons.name: Jason Grosse
persons.context: Jason Grosse is listed as an alternate contact in the email.

keyFacts: Harry Beller sent an email regarding cash transfer requests on October 2, 2013.
Janet E. Young provided a summary of the status of six cash transfer requests.
The total cash amounts discussed include significant sums, such as $14,454,510.95 and $18,755,048.50.
The email emphasizes the need to confirm any outstanding ACH debits or checks.
The correspondence is marked as confidential under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e).
